thread.title: ESIC college starts next year: Kaul
thread.title_full: ESIC college starts next year: Kaul

author: tribuneindia.com
title: ESIC college starts next year: Kaul
text:
Our Correspondent
Kangra, October 17
A three-day annual conference of the 16th Northern chapter of the Indian Anaesthesiologists Society began at the DRPGMC in Tanda today. Health Minister Kaul Singh Thakur was the chief guest on the occasion. He said ESIC Medical College at Nehar Chowk in Mandi district would start functioning in August next year and the Emergency Medicine Departments would start working at the IGMC, Shimla, and the DRPGMC. He said the government was committed to providing quality medical education for the benefit of common people of the state. He said Rs 15 crore was sanctioned for the Liquid Oxygen Pipeline at the Tanda medical college and Rs 4.5 crore for modernisation of the operation theatres. He said work on the construction of hostels would begin soon. He said a cancer hospital would be constructed in Mandi at a cost of Rs 45 crore and a cancer hospital in Shimla would be upgraded at a cost of Rs 45 crore. He lauded the efforts of medical staff of the Zonal Hospital in Dharamsala for getting a reward of Rs 50 lakh. He said Himachal was ahead of many other states in the field of health care. He said due to the efforts and awareness campaign of the government, the sex ratio in the state was better than other states of the country. Transport Minister GS Bali was the guest of honour. He said Tanda had attained a name on national level in a very short time. He also deliberated on the achievements in the field of anaesthesia. A souvenir of the 16th Northern chapter of the Indian Anaesthesiologists Society was released by the ministers on the occasion. Principal Anil Chauhan, national president of the association Dr Nandita Mehta, member national governing body of the association Dr Sunil Katyal and Dr Naveen Malhotra also spoke on the occasion. Dr Sudharshan Kumar, president of the DRPGMC Tanda Unit of Association welcomed the guests.
